item.title: Israel crush: Dozens killed at Lag B'Omer religious festival
item.description: More than 100 are also injured at an event near Mount Meron that attracted tens of thousands.

item.title: Bafta suspends Noel Clarke over harassment claims
item.description: It follows allegations published in the Guardian, which the actor and director denies.

item.title: Boris Johnson's personal phone number available online for years
item.description: Boris Johnson's number is revealed to have been published as part of a press release in 2006.

item.title: Covid deaths: More than 20m living in areas with zero fatalities
item.description: Analysis by the BBC suggests the UK is moving into a new phase of the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: Millions living in areas with no deaths and vaccine rollout extended
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Friday morning.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine offered to people aged 40 and over in England
item.description: Nine out of every 10 people aged 45 and over have now had a jab in England, NHS officials say.

item.title: Restaurants struggle to find staff ahead of reopening
item.description: Some venues may have to limit their opening hours after more than one in ten hospitality workers left the sector.

item.title: Julia James: Community officer died from significant head injuries
item.description: Police say they have no motive or suspects following the death of PCSO Julia James near Dover.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: Lawyers release photo that shows bruised face
item.description: Lawyers release a photo of the British socialite with what looks like bruising under her left eye.

item.title: 'Heartbreaking' return to St Vincent's volcano-hit 'red zone'
item.description: A teacher returns to a village in St Vincent's restricted, volcano-damaged 'red zone'.

item.title: Capt Sir Tom 100: Family and celebrities embark on their own '100 challenge'
item.description: Celebrities including David Beckham are also marking what would have been Captain Sir Tom's 101st birthday.

item.title: Student university complaints reach highest level
item.description: The universities watchdog received 2,604 complaints in 2020, with Â£742,132 paid as compensation.

item.title: The Papers: 'Strictly want Carrie' and Clarke denies claims
item.description: Friday's papers continue to report the row over the PM's flat - and allegations against actor Noel Clarke.

item.title: World's longest pedestrian suspension bridge to open in Portugal
item.description: Local residents tested out the 500m walkway, which spans a gorge in Portugal's Arouca Geopark.

item.title: England's 20th Century coastal communities seen from above
item.description: Photos of England's popular coastal communities seen from the air during the 20th Century.

item.title: Bradley to host BBC's new Blankety Blank series
item.description: Bradley Walsh will host popular the resurrected game show after the success of a festive special.

item.title: Henny Beaumont: Painting the female victims of violence
item.description: Illustrator and cartoonist Henny Beaumont on why she's memorialising female victims of violence.

item.title: The scam that targets dog owners
item.description: When Sharon's dog Ronnie went missing, she fell victim to an increasingly common scam.

item.title: Huge hailstones land in Texas and Oklahoma
item.description: Hailstones as big as 4 inches (10cm) in diameter have been reported.

item.title: William and Kate release video to thank supporters
item.description: On their tenth wedding anniversary, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have thanked people for their support over the years.

item.title: Willow Smith opens up about being polyamorous
item.description: The 20-year-old tells her mum and grandma on TV that she doesn't want to just 'step into monogamy'.

item.title: Xueli Abbing: The abandoned baby who became a Vogue model
item.description: The 16-year-old's albinism led to her being abandoned as a baby but she is now a successful model.

item.title: Boris Johnson flat row: What do we know about the PMâs finances?
item.description: With controversy over the Downing Street flat redecoration, how much does the prime minister earn?

item.title: How a tribute band inspired Royal Blood's new music
item.description: Frontman Mike Kerr says he ditched dozens of songs after watching tribute act Royal Monster in 2018.

item.title: 'It's your device, you should be able to repair it'
item.description: The BBC talks to the volunteers running free workshops to help consumers fix broken gadgets.

item.title: Australians stuck overseas 'abandoned' by their own country
item.description: Australians in India are the latest group to feel abandoned by their government amid virus fears.

item.title: The ransomware surge ruining lives
item.description: A coalition is calling for action from governments as victims describe crippling cyber-attacks.

item.title: India Covid: A nurse's story of fighting the virus
item.description: A nurse at the forefront of the battle against India's deadly second Covid wave shares her story.

item.title: Lawrence gets first pick as quarterbacks dominate NFL draft
item.description: Trevor Lawrence becomes the first overall pick of the 2021 NFL draft after being selected by the Jacksonville Jaguars.

item.title: Man Utd put six past Roma in Europa League semi-final
item.description: Bruno Fernandes and Edinson Cavani both score twice as Manchester United come from behind to take a major step towards sealing a place in next month's Europa League final.

item.title: Pepe penalty gives Arsenal hope despite defeat at Villarreal
item.description: Nicolas Pepe's second-half penalty gives Arsenal renewed hope of reaching the Europa League final despite a semi-final first-leg loss at Villarreal as both sides finish with 10 men.

item.title: Superb Wilson takes control against Murphy in World Championship semi
item.description: Kyren Wilson produces a relentless potting display to open up a commanding 6-2 lead over Shaun Murphy in their World Championship semi-final.

item.title: Sport prepares for social media boycott to tackle abuse and discrimination
item.description: Leading football clubs will be joined by a number of sporting bodies for a four-day boycott of social media to tackle abuse and discrimination.

item.title: NFL draft: Number one pick Trevor Lawrence 'as good as people say'
item.description: The NFL Show's Jason Bell looks at the big prospects in the NFL draft, including quarterback Trevor Lawrence, who joined Jacksonville Jaguars as the number one pick.

item.title: 2021 elections: A simple guide to the Scottish, Welsh and local elections
item.description: A bumper crop of elections are being held on 6 May across England, Scotland and Wales.

item.title: 2021 elections: What elections can I vote in this year?
item.description: National elections in Scotland and Wales and local elections in England are scheduled for 6 May 2021.

item.title: Elections 2021: Teenage Welsh voters' hopes for historic first vote
item.description: Teenage voters in Wales tell BBC Radio 5 Live how they feel about voting for the first time.

item.title: London Elections 2021: Top tasks facing the next mayor
item.description: The next mayor will run a Â£19bn budget and head London's key institutions.

item.title: Election 2021: PCC role in spotlight amid Bristol protests
item.description: What do young voters in Bristol know about about the role of the police and crime commissioner?

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Northern Ireland is the latest part of the UK to lift some of the restrictions designed to stop the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 34 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's happening with pools, haircuts and gyms?
item.description: Lockdown has been eased further - but what does it mean for hairdressers, pools and gyms?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: International travel: The green list, red list and quarantine rules
item.description: An NHS app is being adapted to be used as a Covid passport for people holidaying abroad.

item.title: Covid: Can you catch the virus outside?
item.description: The risks of catching Covid indoors are well-known, but what are the chances of being infected outdoors?

item.title: What are the Indian, Brazil, South Africa and UK variants?
item.description: Cases are being found in the UK and the changes the virus is undergoing are concerning.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - but big celebrations with lots of guests are some way off.

item.title: Why India's Covid crisis matters to the whole world
item.description: The situation in India is a bleak reminder that none of us will be safe until everyone is safe.
